CatDescriptText: Dorothy Greene, clerk, Human Relations Commission, 483 Suisman Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?" answer reads: "A married woman with children makes the better teacher in my opinion because she has some knowledge of how children act, whereas one without children, a single woman, perhaps would be impatient."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dorothy Greene wearing eyeglasses and light colored short sleeve blouse with ruffled trim, holding Scotch Magnetic Tape box, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
